newsitem.title: USA: Navitel enters alliance with Microsoft.
newsitem.headline: Navitel enters alliance with Microsoft.

text.p: Navitel Communications Inc on Tuesday said Microsoft Corp would make an unspecified equity investment in the company.
In exchange Navitel agreed to develop systems and applications software made for Microsoft's Windows CE platform, it said.
Microsoft also will be represented on the board of the private company by Greg Stanger, director of business development and investments.

"Microsoft is pleased to be working with Navitel. We see a significant future for Internet telephone-related appliances, and Navitel is a leading software developer in this emerging category." Craig Mundie, Microsoft senior vice president, said in a press release.
Navitel's chief executive and president, Randy Adams, said the alliance and investment "significantly strengthens Navitel's position as an Internet consumer products company."
Navitel said it would end its hardware development program and divest its current hardware products to focus on Windows CE-based systems and applications software.
